title: Fact Check: BBC has not called Left rally in Kolkata the world’s largest political gathering
content: AFWA has found the claim to be false. In fact, BBC had not even covered Sunday’s Brigade Parade Ground event.
author: Arpit Basu India Today

title: Fact Check: Two-year-old Left Front rally in Kolkata shared as Feb 28 gathering
content: This image of a sea of people is going viral on social media with the claim that is from Sunday’s joint rally of Left Front and Congress in Kolkata’s Brigade Parade Ground ahead of the 2021 Bengal assembly elections. India Today's AFWA probes the truth.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, it’s not mandatory for users to verify their social media accounts within 3 months
content: A viral post on social media claims that in accordance with the new guidelines, within three months, all social media accounts need to be verified with a government ID. However, the government has only asked the social media platforms to provide an appropriate mechanism for users who wish to verify their accounts voluntarily.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Know the real story behind this vintage spring wheel bicycle
content: An image of a vintage bicycle with unique spring wheels and a rifle attached to it is viral with the claim that it is from the British period. India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that this is a German bicycle that was used in World War I.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, the Indian national flag is not banned inside Gujarat's Narendra Modi Stadium
content: A video showing a group of cricket fans alleging that they were not allowed to take the Indian national flag inside the Motera Stadium is viral on social media. It is being said that the Tricolour has been banned in the stadium which is named after the PM.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral image of petrol bill asking not to vote for PM Modi is fake
content: An image of a petrol bill purportedly by an 'HPL' dealer named Sai Balaji Petroleum in Mumbai’s Vikhroli is viral on social media. The text along with the image asks readers to not vote for Prime Minister Narendra Modi the next time if they want reduced petrol prices.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Five-year-old picture of unrest passed off as recent clashes in Srinagar
content: A picture of masked youths pelting stones started circulating on social media with the claim that clashes erupted at Srinagar’s Batmaloo area during a cordon and search operation (CASO) recently. India Today's AFWA probes the truth.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: 2018 video of Varanasi flyover collapse shared with misleading claims
content: A short clip showing several vehicles with passengers inside crushed under a concrete slab is circulating on social media with different claims. While some say the video was taken after the under-construction Balanagar-Jeedimetla flyover in Hyderabad collapsed, others say it is a recent incident from Uttar Pradesh.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of Meerut man spitting on rotis shared as incident from Hyderabad
content: A disturbing video shows a man spitting on rotis while cooking at Red Rose Palace function hall in Hyderabad’s Nampally area.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This video of BJP workers attacking a house is not from Bengal
content: The viral video of BJP workers pelting stones and furniture at a house is not from Bengal, but Telangana.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of BJP workers forming human flag is not from Yogi’s rally in Kerala
content: A picture of a large gathering of people forming the BJP symbol lotus is being circulated on social media linking it to the BJP’s “Vijay Yatra” in Kasaragod district of poll-bound Kerala.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: These are not RSS workers dragged through the streets of Kerala by Popular Front
content: A short clip of a group of Muslims marching two men in RSS uniforms is circulating on social media with the claim that Popular Front of India (PFI) activists in Kerala’s Muslim-majority Malappuram district chained and paraded Sangh workers publicly through the streets.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Rescue operation in Uttarakhand shared as Indian Army destroying Chinese bunkers
content: A one-minute video is viral on social media with the claim that it shows the Indian Army removing the Chinese bunkers from the banks of Pangong Tso Lake. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim along with the video is misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this green flag in a Congress rally is not a Pakistani flag
content: An image that shows the Pakistani national flag being waved during a Congress rally is being shared widely by social media users.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Web series shoot passed off as terrorists nabbed in Mumbai
content: India Today's AFWA probes a video which reportedly shows police arresting a group of terrorists from the Pydhonie area of South Mumbai.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not Nirmala Sitharaman with Jayalalithaa in vintage pic
content: A black-and-white image of J Jayalalithaa along with another woman has gone viral with the claim that this is a rare picture of the former Tamil Nadu chief minister and Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of Greta Thunberg having food in front of poor kids is morphed
content: Amid the ongoing toolkit case, an image showing Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg, eating luxuriously in front of poor and starving children has gone viral on social media. The image is being shared with the trending hashtag #AskGretaWhy.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Fake West Bengal election schedule circulates on social media
content: A post circulating on social media claims that the election schedule for West Bengal has been announced. The upcoming assembly elections will be held in seven phases between April 1 and May 17.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: These are not Bajrang Dal members in UP demanding repeal of farm laws
content: The picture is of a Shiv Sena protest in Maharashtra’s Hingoli district on February 5 against fuel price hike.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This story about a treasure trove in Kashmir has an Italian connection
content: A picture of a broken container lying in mud and filth but filled with gold coins is circulating on social media. The story along with the picture says the coins were discovered by a labourer while digging a canal near Wular lake in Jammu and Kashmir. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the picture is not from India but the Italian town of Como.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of traffic jam in China shared as German protest against fuel price hike
content: A picture of a massive traffic jam in China’s Shenzhen city in 2012 has gone viral as German protest against the fuel price hike.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: These pictures of farmers’ protest in Berlin are over a year old
content: Amid the ongoing farmers’ protest in India, a set of three pictures showing several tractors parked on the roads in long lines has gone viral on social media with the claim that these are visuals from a recent farmers’ demonstration in Berlin.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Bhagat Singh, Sukhdev and Rajguru were not sentenced to death on February 14
content: "February 14 is not just Valentine's Day. On this day in 1931, Bhagat Singh, Sukhdev and Rajguru were sentenced to death in Lahore," some social media users are claiming.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old images from Turkey shared as damage caused by earthquake in Afghanistan
content: A set of three images showing people standing amid the debris of a collapsed building is being circulated with claims that these are scenes from the recent earthquake in Afghanistan. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim along with the images is misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, these earthquake destruction scenes are not from Tajikistan
content: A day after a strong earthquake jolted Tajikistan in central Asia, two pictures of critically damaged buildings have gone viral on social media. It is being said that the pictures are from Tajikistan, taken after the earthquake struck the country.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not Amulya, the girl who raised ‘Pakistan Zindabad’ slogans in 2020, at the farmers' protest
content: Amulya Leona Noronha, a journalism student studying in Bengaluru, was arrested on February 20, 2020, when she had stood on a stage and raised “Pakistan zindabad” slogans during a speech.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of housing project in Bangladesh shared as Mamata’s scheme for slum dwellers
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the picture to be misleading.
author: Arpit Basu India Today

title: Fact Check: Delhi HC has not ordered release of protesters held during farmers’ agitation
content: A viral message on social media claims that the Delhi high court has ordered release of all protesters held by Delhi Police during the ongoing farmers’ movement.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: The man who was playing double role of Naseeruddin Shah and Rakesh Tikait on Twitter
content: A Twitter handle, "@naseruddin_shah", had nearly 60,000 followers before it was first deleted on the evening of January 9, and then put up again. Incidentally, this handle was earlier impersonating farmer leader Rakesh Tikait and tweeting pro-farmer and anti-government posts. Read on to know the truth behind the Twitter account.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Undertaker would rise from the dead after this morphed tweet in support of farmers
content: A screenshot of a tweet supporting the farmers’ protest, which looks like it was posted from the verified handle of Undertaker, has gone viral on social media. The image shows the wrestler holding a placard saying “LET’S TEAM UP!” India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the text in the screenshot is morphed.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: NASA has nothing to do with this edited image of the sun’s surface
content: A stunning picture apparently showing the sun’s dazzling surface is viral on social media with the claim that it was published by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Was Sharad Pawar slapped in public for his statement on Tendulkar?
content: A short clip of Sharad Pawar getting slapped by a man in public is circulating on social media after Pawar had asked Tendulkar to “exercise caution while speaking about any other field”.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Avalanche video from Nepal shared as Uttarakhand glacier burst
content: A video of a huge mass of snow sliding down a mountain is being circulated on social media with the claim that it shows the glacier burst in Uttarakhand’s Chamoli on Sunday.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This emotional post about a farmer and his soldier son is misleading
content: A set of images are going viral on social media with the claim that soon after getting leave, a soldier rushed to Delhi border to meet his father, who has been protesting against the farm laws for 75 days.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This video of liquor distribution is not from farmers’ protest
content: A video has gone viral on social media with the claim that it shows free alcohol distribution among farmers protesting against the three farm laws. AFWA probes the truth.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral tweet on ‘Hindu Mukt India’ by Bollywood singer is fake
content: A screenshot of a communally charged tweet purportedly by Indian playback singer Caralisa Monteiro is viral on social media that declares India will be “Hindu Mukt” soon.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Morphed photo shows Congress workers offering cake to Mia Khalifa's poster
content: An image showing a group of Congress party workers offering cake to Khalifa's poster is viral on social media. The caption to one such image reads, "So much enslaved mentality? Height of Appeasement... uff.. the Congi Way ! @INCIndia most effective n anti India ideology!?"
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: List of UP Congress' minority cell members viral with communal twist
content: A post circulating on social media claims that the Congress party in Uttar Pradesh did not appoint even a single district chairman from the Hindu community.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of Nihang Sikhs attacking bus is not related to farmers’ protest
content: A video showing a group of Nihang Sikhs arguing with a bus driver and attacking the bus with swords is viral on social media. It is being claimed that it is a scene from the ongoing farmers’ protest.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a widowed professor carrying his baby to class
content: Several Twitter users have shared a collage, claiming that these are pictures of a professor who lost his wife during childbirth and is taking care of his child while taking classes. AFWA probes the truth.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: These antique steel-wheeled tractors have no connection with farmers’ protests
content: Old photos of vintage tractors are being circulated with claims farmers are preparing tractors with steel wheels to overcome nails and spikes installed near protest sites.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This article praising PM Modi was not published by ‘The New York Times’
content: An article eulogising Prime Minister Narendra Modi, said to be written by the editor-in-chief of “The New York Times”, is being widely circulated on social media. AFWA probes the truth.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This was not the rush at Borivali station after local trains resumed in Mumbai
content: A video going viral on social media claims to shows the crowd at Mumbai’s Borivali station on February 1, the day suburban trains resumed for the general public after a 10-month gap. AFWA probes the truth.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of Japan’s lightning-fast electric train is not real
content: A video of a train ride is being shared on social media along with the claim that the new electric train in Japan is twice as fast as an F-16 fighter aircraft.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This image of men in police gear and civil clothes is not linked to farmers’ stir
content: A post circulating on social media claims that a group of men in civil dress, donning helmets and other protective gear usually worn by law enforcement agencies are deployed by Delhi Police at farmers’ protest. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Pro-Khalistan rally in San Francisco passed off as farmers’ agitation in India
content: An image of a man holding a placard against the Ram temple has gone viral with the claim that it was taken during the ongoing farmers’ agitation.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No boyfriend, no entry? These college circulars are too filmy to be true
content: Posts going viral on social media claim that the SRM Institute of Science and Technology, Chennai, and St. John’s College, Agra, have issued circulars making it mandatory for female students to have a boyfriend.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: No, 200 policemen in Delhi haven't resigned in support of farmers
content: A post circulating on social media claims that 200 policemen in Delhi have tendered mass resignation in solidarity with the protesting farmers. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Unrelated image shared as police action against protesting farmers
content: According to the reports, the picture is from the violence that broke out at the tractor rally on Republic Day.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of water tanker hitting women en route farmers' protest has no political connection
content: A video has gone viral with a claim that in a moment of rage, a BJP official hit some women with a water tanker and ran over them, when they were on their way to participate in the farmers’ protest march in Delhi.
author: Arpit Basu India Today

title: Fact Check: Seven-year-old image from UP wrongly linked to farmers’ agitation
content: An image of a man wearing a Modi t-shirt attacking police personnel has gone viral. The image has been linked to the ongoing farmers’ protest. India Today Anti-Fake News War room (AFWA) found that the viral image is seven-year-old and is from Uttar Pradesh.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This video of police damaging CCTV is not linked to January 26 tractor rally
content: The tractor rallies organised in Delhi on January 26 by farmers against the three farm laws had turned violent, resulting in clashes between protesters and police.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Dr Kafeel Khan was not part of tractor rally in Delhi on Republic Day
content: A picture of Dr Kafeel Khan on a tractor is being widely circulated on social media with the claim that he was part of the January 26 tractor rally in Delhi. Khan was an accused in the Gorakhpur infant deaths case.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Pulwama attack protest pictures shared as January 26 tractor rally violence
content: A set of images showing cars on fire is viral on social media with the claim that these are scenes from the protest. India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of cops pursuing sand mafia passed off as UP police chasing farmer
content: A video of Uttarakhand Police chasing a man allegedly involved in illegal sand mining is being wrongly circulated as Uttar Pradesh Police chasing a farmer on his way to Delhi to participate in the January 26 tractor rally.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Rahul Gandhi did not suggest replacing Indian Army with labourers at China border
content: A video of Rahul Gandhi speaking at a public meeting in Tamil Nadu is viral on social media with the claim that the Congress leader suggested replacing the Indian Army with labourers, farmers and workers at the volatile China border.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth of the flag hoisted at Red Fort by protesting farmers
content: Calling it a Black Day for India, several Twitter and Facebook users claimed that the Khalistani flag was raised at Red Fort. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that it was not a Khalistani flag but the Nishan Sahib, a religious flag of Sikhs, which was raised at Red Fort.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Edited clip of Mamata reciting Islamic prayers linked to Netaji event controversy
content: Amid row over West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee refusing to give her speech at an event in honour of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose over chants of 'Jai Shri Ram', a video is going viral on social media which shows the chief minister leading Islamic prayers. India Today's AFWA probes the truth.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Decade-old image of Friday namaz at US Capitol Hill viral with misleading claims
content: Social media users are sharing an image showing a Friday namaz held at the foot of US Capitol Hill after Joe Biden became the US President.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, WhatsApp is not recording your calls but privacy concerns can't be ruled out yet
content: A message is going viral on social media which makes several startling claims related to WhatsApp's new privacy-related terms and policies.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Biden didn’t ignore India; foreign leaders are not invited to US Presidential inauguration
content: A viral post on social media claims that Biden invited all of India’s neighbours for his inaugural ceremony, however, India was not invited to the event.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: These officials posing for Covid-19 vaccine is not what it looks like
content: A video in which a man and a woman are seen posing for vaccination pictures is circulating on social media with the claim that officials in Karnataka’s Tumkur are faking it for the cameras while pretending to take Covid-19 vaccines.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This Trump letter needling Biden on election victory is fake
content: A farewell note apparently written by Donald Trump to Joe Biden before he vacated the Oval Office is doing the rounds on social media.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Morphed images of Thailand floods inundate social media
content: Social media users are sharing images that show clear blue flood waters in Thailand’s Pattani province.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Bill Gates never said Covid vaccines will kill or disable 7 lakh people
content: Social media users are sharing a claim that Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has said in an interview to CNBC that 7 lakh people face death or disability due to the Covid-19 vaccines.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Yogi govt will not shut madrasas that do not celebrate Republic Day
content: The Yogi Adityanath government in Uttar Pradesh will shut down madrasas which do not celebrate Republic Day on January 26, according to a viral message on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Conspiracy theory claims Covid-19 vaccine caused new strain in UK
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found that UK approved Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine on Dec 2, and started the vaccination process on Dec 8. The new Covid variant emerged in the UK in Sept 2020, suggesting it has no connection with the vaccine.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Bill Gates, vaccines and population control make for infectious conspiracy theory
content: Social media users are sharing an old newspaper article that highlights Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates’s plan to depopulate the world through forced vaccination.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post claiming death of 17 female docs in Karnataka bus crash is misleading
content: Social media users have claimed that as many as 17 female professors from JJM Medical College in Karnataka’s Davangere district who were on a trip to Goa died in a fatal bus mishap.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Modi govt is not introducing 'one nation, one power tariff' law
content: A message circulating on social media claims that India may be heading towards a uniform power tariff policy. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of truck that caught fire goes viral with misleading claims
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the incident took place not in Hyderabad but on Warje bridge in Pune over a month back.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This ‘Islamophobic’ news headline about Kerala cricketer Azharuddeen is fake
content: An apparent screenshot of a news headline saying “Kerala born Muslim boy blasts Mumbai” has gone viral.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Hima Das has not yet qualified for the 2021 Tokyo Olympics
content: Social media users are sharing a post claiming that India’s sprint sensation Hima Das has qualified for Tokyo Olympics 2021.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image of animal rights campaign viral with misleading claims
content: A picture has gone viral on social media with the claim that it shows a woman portraying a bird injured by the flying kites during Makar Sankranti.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not a rehearsal by protesting farmers for January 26 tractor rally
content: The video in question is from a charity event held in Germany in December 2020 and has been circulating on social media even before farmers announced the tractor rally.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No board exams in Bengal this year? Mamata’s edited clip goes viral
content: According to a clip going viral on Facebook, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has announced that students of classes 10 and 12 do not have to appear for state board exams in 2021 and they’ll be promoted automatically due to the pandemic.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not an Australian astronaut jumping from spaceship to Earth
content: A video along with the claim that it shows an Australian astronaut jumping to Earth from a spaceship in four minutes is circulating on social media. However, AFWA has found the claim to be misleading
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Conspiracy theory on bird flu linking bird deaths to Jio 5G trial goes viral
content: Several social media users have alleged that the recent deaths of birds reported from across the country are the result of 5G tests conducted by Reliance Jio and not a bird flu outbreak.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image of assaulted woman goes viral targeting 'Beti Bachao' campaign
content: A set of two pictures showing a woman bleeding from the head and surrounded by policemen has gone viral with the claim that this is the real face of the Narendra Modi government's "Beti Bachao" campaign. This 2016 picture is from Mainpuri in Uttar Pradesh when the state was under Samajwadi Party rule.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post on 'Made-in-India' Signal, Sanskrit coding is a work of satire
content: Several claims are doing the rounds on social media that said Sanskrit coding was used to develop Signal, a cross-platform encrypted messaging service. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the entire message was initially posted on Reddit as satire, which was later picked up by many social media users who thought it to be true.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old pictures of air mishaps linked to Indonesia plane crash
content: A post circulating on social media has a set of four pictures apparently of relief operations in the aftermath of the crash. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that of the four pictures, only one is related to the recent plane crash in Indonesia.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This baby was not aboard the Indonesia flight that crashed
content: A picture of a baby in life jacket and surrounded by people has gone viral on social media with the claim that the toddler has survived the Indonesia plane crash. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the baby was a survivor from a boat that sank off Indonesia's Selayar island on July 3, 2018.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Two-year-old clip of man blackening Hindi text on signboard linked to farmers’ stir
content: A video of a turbaned man blackening the Hindi text on a signboard is circulating on social media with the claim that it is from Punjab, and the real agenda of farmers’ protest is to oppose Hindi and Hindus.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Obama never warned Africans against Covid-19 vaccines from US, Europe
content: A message circulating on social media says former United States President Barack Obama has warned Africans not to accept vaccines that will come from America and Europe. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that there is no official trace of any such statement by the former US President.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Visualisation of a project in Belgium passed off as swanky Ambedkar library in US
content: Pictures are being circulated on social media of a building, claiming that it is a library in the US named after Dr BR Ambedkar.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Know the truth behind Google's 'self-driving' bicycle
content: A video of a "self-driving" bicycle passing through the roads of the city is viral on social media with the claim that it is a revolution in cycle invention by the American tech giant Google. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim is misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Centre has not removed the nationality column from Indian passports
content: The official spokesperson to the Ministry of External Affairs confirmed to Indian Today that the nationality column is maintained in all travel documents including the passport, issued by the Indian government.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Ex-Army man's video in support of farmers' protest shared with misleading claims
content: In a viral video, a Sikh man who claims to be an Army jawan is heard saying that he was labelled a "terrorist" for standing with the protesting farmers at Delhi border.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This 'SSC' notice on new 'Tier-0' level exam to deal with server woes is fake
content: Some social media users are claiming has been claiming that the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has introduced a new 'Tier-0' level exam to deal with heavy traffic on its servers. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the notice which is being circulated on social media in the name of SSC is morphed.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: This Batman wanted to save the city, but the video is not from Capitol Hill
content: A video of a man dressed in Batman suit started circulating on social media with the claim that this was how one of the protesters arrived at the US Capitol Hill along with Donald Trump supporters who stormed the building on January 6. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral clip is from last year.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: After Capitol Hill siege by Trump supporters, Merkel’s parody tweet goes viral
content: In the message attributed to German Chancellor Angela Merkel, she says that her “departure from office is going to be very boring”, in an apparent reference to the Capitol Hill violence.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of 2013 Kumbh Mela gathering passed off as farmers' protest
content: An aerial view of hundreds of tents on an open ground is circulating on social media with the claim that this is how the "world's largest protest" - the farmers' agitation - looks like. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the picture used is of the 2013 Maha Kumbh Mela at Prayagraj.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Fake 'National Geographic' magazine cover featuring farmers' protest goes viral
content: An image that looks like a magazine cover with "National Geographic" written on it, along with a picture of a man wearing a turban, has gone viral with the claim that the cover story of the magazine features the ongoing farmers' protests at the Delhi border. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the said cover image is actually an imaginary artwork by an Instagram user.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Placard seeking release of Kashmiri separatists is not from farmers' protest
content: A picture of a young man in turban, holding a placard demanding the release of separatist Kashmiri leaders, is viral on social media with the claim that it is a scene from the ongoing farmers' agitation. A picture of a young man in turban, holding a placard demanding the release of separatist Kashmiri leaders, is viral on social media with the claim that it is a scene from the ongoing farmers' agitation.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of Pride parade from Kolkata goes viral as JNU protest against Hindu culture
content: A picture of a woman with some other people has gone viral on social media with the claim that these are students of Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) protesting against Hindu women wearing saree and sindoor. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the picture was taken in 2019 at a Pride parade in Kolkata.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Farmer seen collapsing on video at Singhu Border has not passed away
content: A video has emerged where it has been claimed that a farmer died after collapsing at Singhu Border during the ongoing protests. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the video to be untrue.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens mistake artwork for cloud pattern over Mumbai
content: A stunning image, apparently of mammatus clouds, is circulating on social media with the claim that the sight was photographed over Mumbai skies. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be untrue.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind ‘Mandir Banao’ campaign in Pakistan
content: Netizens claim that Muslims in Pakistan have started the ‘Mandir Banao’ campaign after a Hindu temple was destroyed in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Fake news of Pakistan pilot urinating in F-16 cockpit shared as Dawn report
content: A screenshot, apparently of Pakistan's leading English newspaper Dawn is viral on social media with claims that a "pilot pissing in the cockpit of PAF F-16 said urine increases efficiency of jets told by Allah in his dream". India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the screenshot is photoshopped.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Indian government has not approved pharmacists to run clinics in the country
content: A Hindi newspaper clipping has gone viral on social media with the claim that the Centre has approved pharmacists in the country to open clinics and prescribe medicine to patients. What is the truth behind the claim?
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Kejriwal did not begin New Year 2021 by offering namaz at Jama Masjid
content: A photo of Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal wearing a skull cap has gone viral with a claim that the CM ushered in the New Year by offering a namaz at the Jama Masjid in Delhi. How true is the claim? Find out!
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Kerala has not banned Jio Internet services in the state
content: Amid the ongoing farmers’ agitation, the Kerala Assembly on Thursday (December 31), passed a unanimous resolution demanding repeal of the Centre’s three contentious agricultural laws. Now, if a viral claim circulating on social media is to be believed, the Kerala government has decided to ban operations of Reliance Jio in the state from 2021.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a Jio tower set on fire amid farmers’ protest
content: A short video clip of a burning mobile tower is circulating on social media with the claim that it is a Jio tower set on fire during the farmers’ agitation. The caption in Hindi with one such video translates to, “Effect of farmers’ movement! Jio tower set on fire”. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. This is a 2017 video from Dehradun and not related to the ongoing farmers’ agitation.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: PM Modi never said Vajpayee started the first Metro in India
content: Many on social media have claimed that PM Modi, in a speech, had said the credit for the first metro service in the country goes to late PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of platform ticket with ‘Adani Railway’ on it is morphed
content: A photo on social media is going viral with the claim that train platform tickets in Pune now have “Adani Railway” written on them.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this picture of Narendra Modi is not with the staff of Prime Minister’s Office
content: While senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh recently called Prime Minister Narendra Modi unjust towards the farmers of the country, an image of him sitting on stairs with a group of men is viral on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Don't fall for this morphed CNN visual claiming Covid vaccine turns people into zombies
content: A screenshot of a television news bulletin which shows a hospital ward with blood spilt all around is being widely shared on social media. The screenshot has a 'CNN' logo and a ticker which reads, "Breaking News: Hospitals on lockdown as first Covid vaccine patients start eating other patients." A scroll at the bottom reads, "Nancy Pelosi arrested for DUI". The top right corner of the screenshot has the text "Los Angeles".
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Reliance Jio is not selling food grains, sacks with Jio logos freely available
content: Pictures of food grain sacks with Reliance Jio logos on them have gone viral on social media. Some have called Reliance Jio’s apparent entry in food grain trading a “conspiracy” against farmers. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the sacks with Jio logos on them have nothing to do with Reliance.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of Dubai passed off as Varanasi after PM Modi’s beautification drive
content: A viral picture showing swanky roads and skyscrapers surrounded by blue waters is going viral on social media with the claim that it is the riverside of Varanasi.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This thrilling race between auto-rickshaws is not from India
content: A video has gone viral on social media with the claim that it shows a crazy auto-rickshaw race in India.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: FIFA World Cup win celebrations in Paris viral as march against Covid curbs
content: A picture of a huge gathering of people is circulating on social media with the claim that it captures a major protest held in Paris recently against coronavirus restrictions.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Supreme Court of Nepal has not criminalised loudspeakers in mosques
content: A viral claim circulating on social media claimed the Supreme Court of Nepal has declared the use of loudspeakers in mosques a criminal offence. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This Christmas tree lighting is not at Dubai airport
content: With Christmas approaching, a picture has gone viral on social media showing a long path lit up with colourful lights in such a way that it resembles a Christmas tree. The claim with the photo says it is the runway of Dubai airport.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: US nurse who fainted after Covid-19 vaccine shot is not dead
content: A viral message on social media claims that Tiffany Dover, the nurse in Tennessee, United States, who fainted after receiving her first dose of the Pfizer/BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine, is now dead.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Social media gives ‘Rohingya’ angle to attack on BJP leaders in Bengal
content: With months to go for elections in West Bengal, a video of a mob attack is circulating on social media with the claim that it shows Hindus in the state being thrashed by Rohingyas. Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh can also be seen in the video.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Shaheen Bagh dadi Bilkis Bano is not in jail for meeting farmers
content: Also known as the 'Shaheen Bagh Dadi', Bilkis Bano was denied permission to join the ongoing farmers' agitation at Singhu (Delhi-Haryana) border on December 1.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Iconic bell tower in Tagore's varsity was not razed due to Amit Shah's visit
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the bell tower was damaged in August this year after a banyan tree uprooted and fell on it during a storm. It has nothing to do with Amit Shah's visit to the campus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a 5,000-year-old temple discovered during road widening in Ayodhya
content: An image of a temple amid heaps of rubbles and old buildings is being shared on social media with the claim that it is a 5,000-year-old temple discovered during a road widening exercise in the holy town of Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not George Foreman and Ricky Ponting singing a popular Bollywood song
content: While more and more artists are now making covers of hit Bollywood tracks with unique twists, what is not an everyday event is watching two “foreigners” singing a popular Hindi number.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: PM Modi is not greeting Gautam Adani's wife in this viral picture
content: An image of Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeting a woman with folded hands is circulating on social media with the claim that she is industrialist Gautam Adani's wife Priti Adani. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Altered cover image of TIME shows Xi Jinping as 'Person of the Year'
content: Last week, the Time magazine announced its annual 'Person of the Year' for 2020. Soon after an image of the supposed magazine cover with pictures of Xi Jinping, Joe Biden and Kamala Harris went viral. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral image is altered.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old images of pro-Khalistan demonstrations linked to farmers’ protests
content: A series of old images is going viral on social media with the claim that these are pro-Khalistan posters and banners which were raised during the ongoing farmers’ agitation in Delhi. AFWA probes the truth.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This Sudanese model didn’t marry herself after getting ‘fed up of men’
content: A viral post on social media claims that a Sudanese model Ayuol Manyok got married to herself since she got fed up with men.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not a Pakistani journalist praising PM Modi
content: A short video clip of a man praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi is circulating on social media with the claim that he is a Pakistani journalist. In the 56-second video, the man is heard saying, "No one in the world knew what BJP was. What is the truth behind the claim?
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a supermarket run by farmers in Bengaluru
content: Amid the farmers' protest, some pictures of a huge vegetable store are circulating on social media with the claim that farmers have opened their own supermarket in Bengaluru.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Twisted data about rapes become hot issue before Bengal election
content: Amid the bitter turf war between BJP and Trinamool Congress in West Bengal in the run-up to assembly elections, a graphic circulating on social media claims that as per the 2018 National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data, the state reported the highest number of rape incidents in India.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind SRK’s ‘doppelganger from Kashmir’
content: A photo has gone viral on social media with the claim that it is of a Kashmiri boy who closely resembles superstar Shah Rukh Khan.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Was Pfizer’s first Covid-19 vaccination in the UK a staged event?
content: Margaret Keenan, 90, became the first recipient of Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine in the UK on December 8. Soon after, a story is being narrated about a crisis actor named Liz Scott who allegedly received the first shot of the Covid-19 vaccine by impersonating Keenan.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of pro-Pak, pro-Khalistan rally revived in context of current farmers' agitation
content: A video of people raising pro-Pakistan and pro-Khalistan slogans is doing the rounds on social media. It is being said that the video is of people protesting in London in support of the farmers' agitation in India. A few men in the group can also be seen wearing turbans.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Poster demanding JNU student Sharjeel Imam’s release is not from ongoing farmers’ protest
content: As the farmers' protest in the national capital entered the third week, an image of people holding a banner with "Free Sharjeel Imam" written on it is being shared on social media. It is being said that the image is from the ongoing farmers' protest at the Delhi-Haryana border.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This video of agitating AAP leaders is not linked to CM Kejriwal’s alleged house arrest
content: A video that shows AAP leaders protesting against the alleged house arrest of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal after he met the farmers protesting at the Singhu border is going viral on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not the childhood family photo of Covid-19 vaccine inventor
content: The Turkish-German couple of Ugur Sahin and Özlem Türeci came to the limelight as frontrunners in the race to invent a vaccine for coronavirus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a Wuhan lab that Obama was visiting
content: At a time a vaccine against coronavirus may just become a reality, a set of images of former United States President Barack Obama and top American infectious diseases expert Dr. Anthony Fauci has gone viral, fuelling an old conspiracy theory.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This video of pro-Khalistan rally is not linked to farmers’ protest
content: Farmers’ unions on Wednesday rejected the Centre’s draft proposal to amend the new farm laws, promising to intensify the agitation in the coming days.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh didn't meet Ambani a day before Bharat Bandh
content: Amid farmers' protest, netizens are sharing a picture of Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh and industrialist Mukesh Ambani, with the claim that they met a day before Bharat Bandh to discuss investment projects in Punjab. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video goes viral as Nihang Sikhs marching to Delhi for farmers’ protest
content: Amid the ongoing farmers’ protest, a short clip of Nihang Sikhs marching on the road has gone viral with the claim that 20,000 Nihang Sikhs on 2,000 horses are on their way to Delhi from Punjab to join the farmers. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Obama's tweet snubbing PM Modi over farmers' protest is morphed
content: Amid farmers' protest, an image of a tweet, purportedly made by Barack Obama, has gone viral, in whch Obama is seen shaking hands with PM Modi. The tweet says, "Today I am shamefull for a hand shake with this man… #Narendra Modi". India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the 'screenshot' of Obama's tweet is morphed.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old clip of Rajnath Singh addressing farmers passed off as support to ongoing stir
content: A short clip of Rajnath Singh speaking in support of farmers is viral on social media with the claim that it is a recent video of the defence minister addressing farmers protesting against the new farm laws in Delhi. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is from 2013.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old photo from London passed off as farmers disrespecting Tricolour
content: Amid the ongoing farmers' protest in Delhi, a picture has gone viral on social media with the claim that it shows protesting farmers disrespecting the Indian national flag.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of people waving BJP flags is from Jammu and not PoK
content: A viral video shows BJP flags being waved in what is being claimed as Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). India Today Anti Fake News War Room found this claim to be false.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Fictitious post about Tomar linking Adani, Ambani with farm laws goes viral
content: A video on social media is doing rounds with a claim that Union agriculture minister Narendra Singh Tomar said in the meeting with farmers that if he repeals the farm laws, then "Adani and Ambani can also come to us". India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) spoke to various stakeholders and people present in the meeting, but no one confirmed that Tomar made such a statement.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Owaisi did not say he will convert to Hinduism if BJP wins Hyderabad municipal poll
content: Ahead of the GHMC municipal election in Hyderabad, a social media user claimed that AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said he would convert to Hinduism and name himself Bhagya Raj Tripathi if BJP won the civic body polls.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Justin Trudeau did not sit on dharna to support agitating Indian farmers
content: An image of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau surrounded by people of the Sikh community is being widely circulated with the claim that he is sitting in 'dharna' in support of the ongoing farmers' agitation.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, RBI has not stopped supply of Rs 2,000 currency notes
content: A misleading post on social media claims that the RBI has stopped supply of Rs 2,000 currency notes, due to which only Rs 100, Rs 200 and Rs 500 notes can be withdrawn from ATMs.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image from Jat agitation revived as ongoing farmers’ protest
content: An old image from Jat agitation is now being shared by social media users as ongoing farmers’ protest.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This banner against Lord Ram is not from the ongoing farmers’ protest
content: Social media users are sharing the image of a banner with the claim that anti-Hindu slogans and banners against Lord Ram were raised at the ongoing farmers’ protest near Delhi.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Canadian MP Jack Harris, not Kamala Harris, tweeted on farmers’ stir in India
content: Sharing a screenshot of a tweet, some social media users are claiming that United States Vice President-elect Kamala Harris has joined the list of world leaders supporting the farmers’ stir in India. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the tweet was posted by Canadian MP Jack Harris and not Kamala Harris.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Man with bandaged eye viral as ex-armyman injured during farmers’ protest
content: Two pictures, one of a Sikh man with a bandage to the left eye and another of a Sikh man in military uniform, are viral on social media with the claim that they are the same person – a retired Army officer who was injured during the ongoing farmers’ protests near Delhi.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Did cops nab Muslim SDPI activist disguised as Sikh in farmers' protest?
content: A video of policemen removing the turban of a man has gone viral with the claim that a Muslim disguised as a Sikh was apprehended in Haryana. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is from 2011.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old photo of farmers' long march revived as ongoing protests near Delhi
content: Amid the ongoing farmers' protest, an image of a mass gathering is circulating with the claim that these are the protesting farmers camping outside Delhi, facing inclement weather conditions. India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that this picture was taken in 2018 when farmers in Maharashtra were marching towards Mumbai to gherao the state legislature.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of Khalistan supporters linked to ongoing farmers’ protest
content: A video showing a group of men chanting pro-Khalistan, pro-Pakistan and anti-Modi slogans is going viral on social media with the claim that it is a scene from the farmers’ protest. However, the video is from the ICC World Cup 2019 in the United Kingdom.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: BrahMos launch video shared with false claims of failure
content: Some social media users are claiming that India has failed to launch a surface-to-surface missile a day after India test-fired the Brahmos missile from Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of Pele mourning at Maradona's grave is morphed
content: An image purportedly showing Brazilian football legend Pele mourning at Maradona's grave is viral on social media with emotional captions. The caption of one such image reads, "Pele bids farewell to Maradona. That's painful". Another caption says, "Million dollar picture".
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This massive crowd does not show the funeral procession of legendary Maradona
content: While football fans are still grieving his loss, a video of Maradona's alleged funeral procession has gone viral. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral video is old and has nothing to do with Maradona's funeral procession.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not Congress leader Ahmed Patel's funeral procession
content: A 44-second video of a mass Islamic funeral procession is viral on social media with the claim that these are visuals from the last rites of Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP Ahmed Patel who passed away on November 25.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This white wonderland is not a street in Karachi
content: An image of a snow-covered street has been doing the rounds of social media along with the claim that it is the recent picture of the MA Jinnah Road in Karachi, Pakistan.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: 2017 video of flooded Marina beach shared as recent Cyclone Nivar visuals in Chennai
content: At least three people were killed and over one lakh people have been taken to safety from coastal areas as Cyclone Nivar slammed into Tamil Nadu and Puducherry early on Thursday, uprooting trees and power lines.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Trump did not pay tribute to singer Madonna instead of Maradona
content: While the world is still reeling under the loss of loved ones in the year 2020, Wednesday (November 25) proved to be a rather sad day for football lovers and the sports fraternity at large.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Putin did not ban interfaith marriages for Muslim men in Russia
content: A viral post on social media claims that Russian President Vladimir Putin has banned Muslim men in Russia from marrying non-Muslim women.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens share Shikhar Dhawan’s cropped image to question BCCI’s patriotism
content: A misleading post on social media is claiming that the Indian cricket team’s new jersey has the BYJU’S logo but not India’s name on it as the BCCI prefers money over the country.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Unmasking a fraud running ‘govt’ schemes in PM Modi’s name
content: The India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has unearthed a web of fake websites fraudulently promoting government schemes in the name of PM Modi, all being run by the same person.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: 1938 video of BKS Iyengar shared as PM Modi performing yoga
content: A black-and-white video of a man demonstrating different postures of yoga is viral on social media with the claim that it is a rare footage of Prime Minister Narendra Modi performing asanas.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, PM Modi has not announced another Covid-19 lockdown
content: Is India heading towards another lockdown? With over 91 lakh cases and more than 1.3 lakh deaths, and with the pandemic showing no signs of slowing down, that's the question on everyone's mind.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Who is this woman removing a TRS banner in Hyderabad?
content: The banner which was being removed ahead of the GHMC elections, had pictures of Telangana CM KCR and his son KT Rama Rao along with party symbols.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral video of 'baby giraffes' is too cute to be true
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is not real, but a creation by digital artist Vernon James Manlapaz.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: “Reports” claiming BJP's role behind Trupti Desai's visit to Sabarimala are fake
content: Gender rights activist Trupti Desai’s attempts to visit the Sabarimala temple in Kerala had gained national attention in 2018 and 2019. Women of menstrual age group were not allowed to enter the Sabarimala temple until 2018.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Pakistan's lovable mascot 'Chacha Cricket' hits out of boundary his death rumours
content: Several people on social media are claiming that Pakistani cricket's evergreen mascot Chaudhry Abdul Jalil, better known as Chacha Cricket, is no more. A Facebook user wrote, "Pakistani Cricket Chacha is no more with us. RIP. May Allah Raise his Ranks in Jannah (Ameen)." What's the truth behind the claim?
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a video of White House welcoming Joe Biden with Vedic chants
content: While Donald Trump is yet to acknowledge Joe Biden as the United States President-elect, the latter’s win margin is heading towards a record 80 million votes
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of Yogi Adityanath burning crackers is not from Diwali
content: In view of the Covid-19 situation, several states had put restrictions on the sale and use of firecrackers during Diwali. Uttar Pradesh was one of them. However, on social media, a collage of two videos has gone viral with the claim that while UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath was burning crackers on Diwali, police on the other hand were arresting people for selling fireworks.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of burqa-clad students passed off as Kerala’s all-women police force
content: The burqa-clad women were college students and not in the police.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Joe Biden is not apologising to the daughter of a race victim here
content: A picture of Biden kneeling before a child is going viral with the claim that the US President-elect apologised to the daughter of a “black American who was publicly murdered by a white police officer
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of Kejriwal alleging BJP-AIMIM deal in Bihar is four years old
content: A video where Arvind Kejriwal has claimed there was a secret deal between BJP and AIMIM for the Bihar polls has gone viral on social media.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This video of illegal voting is not from Bihar
content: A video of a man influencing voters inside a polling booth has gone viral with the claim that this is from the recently concluded Bihar elections. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is from the 2019 Lok Sabha elections where a polling agent at Asaoti in Faridabad, Haryana, was caught on video casting votes illegally. He was later arrested.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Joe Biden has not appointed an Indian-origin man as political advisor
content: A picture of a man of Indian origin with US President-elect Joe Biden and his wife Jill Biden is viral on social media. It is being said that the man named Ahmed Khan has been appointed as the political advisor to the President-elect. What's the truth?
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Cylinder explosion in Roorkee goes viral with misleading claim
content: A short clip of fire and smoke billowing in the distance and people lying injured on the ground is circulating on social media with the claim that a sweet shop in Mangalore went up in flames due to a blast caused by 10 cylinders. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the blast took place at a small town called Manglaur Riyasat in Uttarakhand's Haridwar district.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Were sweets dumped in the RJD office after Bihar poll verdict?
content: One of the pictures shows two men overturning a huge pot of sweets into a pit, and the other shows a few people standing near a food dump.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Unrelated photos go viral linking them to recent school blast in Peshawar
content: Distressing images of a wounded child and pencils in a pool of blood have gone viral with the claim that they are from the recent school blast in Peshawar.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Shivling damaged in Ranchi shared with misleading communal claims
content: A viral post on social media claims that the Shivling at a temple in Ranchi’s Rangrez Gali was damaged by Muslims. AFWA probes the truth.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not the funeral procession of man who beheaded French teacher Samuel Paty
content: A video of a mass Islamic funeral procession is circulating on social media with the claim that these are scenes from the last rites of the Chechen descent who beheaded French teacher Samuel Paty in Paris for showing cartoons of Prophet Muhammad in class. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the video to be false.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Fake letter claims PM Modi wants Giriraj Singh as chief minister of Bihar
content: The viral letter in question has several glaring discrepancies which indicate that it is not from the Prime Minister’s office.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, former PM Manmohan Singh is not a chief guest at Joe Biden's swearing-in ceremony
content: Multiple social media handles from India are now claiming that former Indian Prime Minister, Manmohan Singh will be the chief guest at Biden's swearing-in ceremony. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim is false.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens beef up misleading post to target Kamala Harris
content: A picture of Harris consuming meat went viral on social media with the claim that after winning the elections, she had beef in "happiness". India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the picture was taken last year, when Harris was relishing pork at a fair.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Time magazine cover mocking Trump exit from White House is not real
content: On social media, the purported cover page of 'Time' magazine is going viral that shows Trump's silhouette from behind, exiting a doorway. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral image is not a genuine Time magazine cover, but a fabricated mock job.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video from Russia shared as electoral fraud in recent US elections
content: As Democrat candidate Joe Biden beat incumbent Donald Trump in US presidential elections, a CCTV footage is doing rounds, showing some people stuffing what appear to be voting papers into a ballot box is going viral with the claim that this was how election results were rigged in the US. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that it is a two-year-old video from Russia and not related to the recent US elections.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Pornhub logo did not appear on CNN during the US poll coverage
content: A video clip on social media appears to show an adult website logo on CNN's screen during the live US poll coverage. India Today Anti-Fake News War room (AFWA) found the viral video is morphed. The original video of CNN does not show any "Pornhub" banner on the giant screen.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This heartbreaking video of 6-year-old pushing stretcher in hospital is not from Bihar
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video in question is not from poll-bound Bihar but from Deoria district hospital in Uttar Pradesh.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No BSF jawans were killed in this bus accident in Bihar
content: An image of an overturned bus surrounded by BSF personnel is viral on social media. The image is circulated with a claim that as many as nine jawans were killed in a bus accident while on their way for election duty in Darbhanga district. What's the truth behind the claim?
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old pic viral as Erdogan's 'snub' to Macron amid Turkey-France tensions
content: Amid a bitter feud between Turkey and France over the latter's fight against radical Islam, a picture of the two heads of state is being circulated on social media with exactly this claim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a Congress leader arrested for plotting attack on Hindus
content: The Hindi caption along with the images translates to, "Congress leader from Assam Amjat Ali arrested with weapons and bullets in apple boxes. He was planning to kill kafirs. Police caught him. Hindus, they are fully prepared."
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Tejashwi Yadav did not receive any ‘Youngest Politician’ award in London
content: As elections are underway in Bihar, a picture of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav wearing a suit and talking to another man is being shared on social media with the claim that he was conferred the ‘Youngest Politician’ award in London.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of police assault on Muslim woman falsely linked to France
content: A video of a handcuffed woman being slammed on the ground face-first is being widely circulated with the claim that French police tried to rip off a Muslim woman's burqa and assaulted her when she resisted. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video has no connection with France.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video from Belgium shared as anti-Islam speech in French Parliament
content: A video of a man holding the Quran and saying it is the "root of all evil" is circulating on social media with the claim that it is a scene from the French Parliament. What is the truth behind the viral video?
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Fake tweet on France deporting Pakistanis go viral after Imran slams Macron
content: Many media reports have surfaced which say that French authorities cancelled visas of 183 Pakistani citizens and deported 118 from the country.All these media reports have used a tweet posted by the username "Consulate General Of Pakistan France", with the handle "@PakConsulateFr". India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that "@PakConsulateFr" is an imposter account of the Pakistani embassy in France.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, these images are not of the under-construction Ram Temple in Ayodhya
content: A picture of a temple is going viral on social media with the claim that this is the first picture of Ram Mandir which is under construction in Ayodhya.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Morphed screengrab of Rana Ayyub’s old interview goes viral with false claims
content: Amid various reports of turmoil in France, a screengrab of Indian journalist Rana Ayyub’s interview with CNN is viral on social media. According to one claim which shared the screengrab, Ayyub purportedly said that people cannot hate all Muslims just because of two beheadings that took place in France.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of brawl in Brazil falsely shared as Muslim man attacked in France
content: The video is being shared in the backdrop of the beheading of a French teacher outside his school on October 16, 2020.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Pakistan MPs chant ‘Modi, Modi’ inside Parliament?
content: A video clip of the parliamentary proceedings in Pakistan is viral on the internet purportedly showing its members chanting “Modi, Modi”.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact check: No, Munger victim Anurag Poddar’s mother is not dead
content: Poonam Devi, though mentally shattered after the death of her son, otherwise is physically fine.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of police action on Muslims in Turkey revived during recent Erdogan-Macron feud
content: Amid controversies, a video of police using water cannon and tear gas shells on people sitting on a street to offer prayers is circulating on social media. India Today Anti-Fake News War room (AFWA) found the viral video is from Yüksekova in Turkey and not France.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this crowd protesting against BJP is not from Bihar election campaigns
content: While campaigning for the second phase of Bihar election is gathering steam, a video showing a large crowd chanting anti-BJP slogans is going viral on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact check: 3-year-old protest video against street prayers revived after beheading of teacher in Paris
content: Amid the outrage in France over the beheading of a teacher in Paris, a video has gone viral showing people protesting against the street prayers being offered by the Muslims. India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the video is three years old.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of French President Macron egged has no link to remarks on Islam
content: A video of French President Emmanuel Macron having an egg thrown at his face as he is in conversation with some people is circulating on social media. The claim along with the video says Macron was attacked for his remarks on Prophet Mohammad, and calls for a boycott of French products. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the video to be misleading.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Two-year-old protest video against Shivraj Singh revived before MP bypolls
content: A video of a protest rally against Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan is going viral ahead of by-elections on 28 assembly seats on November 3.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old anti-CAA protest in Kolkata goes viral as Bihar’s opposition to PM Modi
content: A viral image of social media claims that PM Modi was greeted with protests and a graffiti saying "Go Back Modi" as soon as he hit the campaign trail for Bihar elections.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image falsely shared as crowd at Yogi Adityanath’s recent Bihar rally
content: An image of a massive crowd has gone viral on social media with the claim that it is from Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's election rally held in Bihar. India Today Anti-Fake News War room (AFWA) has found the viral claim to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump's ‘filthy’ remark on India's air quality goes viral with misleading claims
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim is misleading. During the Presidential debate, Trump described the air quality in India, China and Russia as “filthy”.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral '1950s public service announcement' on Covid-19 is not what it seems
content: A video, which is being said that it was made in 1956, has gone viral on social media. The video, it claims, was a warning against the novel Covid-19 pandemic that is plaguing the world right now. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim is misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not the teacher who was beheaded in Paris over Prophet cartoon
content: A picture of some youths holding “Refugees Welcome” placards is circulating on social media with the claim that one among them is the French teacher Samuel Paty, whose beheaded body was found in the streets of Paris last week. However, the man in the viral picture is not Paty.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Why many believe Telugu is an official language in the US
content: Several Facebook users are making the claim based on an article by “The Hans India”, whose headline reads, “Telugu language recognised as official language in the USA finds place on American ballot box”. Is the claim true?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Muslims will not surpass Hindu population in India anytime soon
content: A Twitter screenshot of a large number of Muslims offering namaaz on the street is viral on social media. The text in the screenshot says Muslims constitute 30 per cent of India's population. Is this true?
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Liquor bottles for flood victims in Thailand linked to Bihar polls
content: Social media is abuzz with pictures alleging that liquor bottles are being circulated by political parties ahead of the 2020 Bihar elections.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Were Indian flags waved at a political rally in Pakistan?
content: Pictures claiming that an Indian flag was raised at a recent opposition rally in Pakistans's Karachi have been doing rounds on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old picture of Swiss music fest passed off as Trump poll rally
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found the claim along with the picture to be false.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens fall for fake Twitter account impersonating Shatrughan Sinha’s son
content: Actor-politician Luv Sinha, son of Shatrughan Sinha, has tweeted that Muslims should raise their voice for IPS Sanjiv Bhatt. However, the tweet was made from an imposter account and Luv hasn’t said any such thing.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Braveheart who saved girl from miscreants goes viral… with a twisted story
content: A picture of a man in red turban is circulating on social media with the claim that he saved a girl from getting gang raped, and killed two of the four attackers. The claim says the incident took place near Shahjahanpur in Uttar Pradesh, and the man is in a serious condition after getting shot thrice.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Know about the man smiling in the face of death, literally
content: A viral Facebook post claims that a man was sentenced to death in Syria because he was a Christian. But he was smiling on his way to be hung because of his faith in Jesus Christ.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of Khushbu Sundar slapping a man resurfaces after she joins BJP
content: A video of Khushbu Sundar slapping a man is viral on social media with the claim that the incident happened after she moved to BJP.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of fishes inside a flooded house falsely linked to recent Hyderabad deluge
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim is misleading. This is an old video and is not related to the current Hyderabad rains.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral clip of traffic signal floating in floodwater is not from Hyderabad
content: A video of a traffic signal post getting swept away in floodwater is circulating on social media with the claim that this is a scene from Hyderabad after heavy downpour. However, the viral video is two years old and from Yulin city of China.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video from Mexico shared as flooded Hyderabad airport
content: A video of a flooded airport is viral on social media with the claim that it is a scene from Hyderabad’s Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. However, it is an old video from the international airport of Mexico City and is not related to Hyderabad.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old videos go viral as visuals from Telangana as rains lash state
content: Amid heavy rainfall, multiple videos are circulating on social media as recent visuals from Hyderabad and its neighboring districts. India Today Anti Fake News War Room fact checked three such videos - one showing a crocodile being rescued from a waterlogged street, another showing rainwater flowing down heavily through the walls of a fort and the third one showing people and two-wheelers being pulled away by floodwaters. All all three claims were found to be misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not the juvenile involved in Nirbhaya’s gang rape and murder
content: A picture of a man in white t-shirt escorted by police is circulating on social media with the claim that he was the juvenile involved in Nirbhaya’s gang rape and murder.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old, unrelated images linked to Nagorno-Karabakh conflict
content: The three-decade-old conflict between Azerbaijan and Armenia over the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region erupted once again last month.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Kirron Kher didn't say rapes cannot be stopped as it's part of our culture
content: Many on social media claimed that Kirron Kher said rape is part of Indian culture and cannot be stopped. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
